result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy L. Koehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation is revoked then huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow 
*1/2 to be served on home monitor if approved by the jail or risk assessment
Concurrent with: 90 days on 15CM255

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs/surcharges 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

*Comply with conditions as set forth in 15CM255:
-Attend and complete a Domestic Abuse Program as approved by the Agent.
-AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
-Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
-Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
-Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L. Koehler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amy L. Koehler in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM229, 15CM255 and 15CM267.

10:48 a.m. Court calls case
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Cousins states that there is a new DA Case # 15PT1675 which is a going to be an uncharged DRI case.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification but no victim's appear in court today.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM229:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CM255:
Count 1 - No contest 

15CM267:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court reviews the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CM229; guilty on Count 1 of 15CM255 and Count 1 on 15CM267 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM229:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence is concurrent to 90 days on 15CM255 Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow if probation is revoked
1/2 to be served on home monitor if approved by the jail or risk assessment.
Placed on probation for 24 months to run with concurrent 15CM255
Pay costs/surcharges 
Comply with conditions in 15CM255

15CM255:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence - if probation revoked Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
1/2 to be served on home monitor if approved by the jail or risk assessment.

Placed on probation for 24 months
Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs/surcharges - domestic abuse 
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
Attend and complete a Domestic Abuse Program as approved by the Agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Pay restitution of $30.60 to Copps Food Center in Plover.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use. 
10 days jail with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
To be served on home monitor if approved by the jail or risk assessment.

15CM267:
Count 1 - DRI

Defendant Amy L. Koehler in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-255, 15CM-267 and 15CM-229.

2:22 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Atty Halverson addresses the Court, requests matter to be adjourned to talk with Atty Cousins  and come with an agreement.

State did comply with victim notification statutes.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

$500 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Amy L. Koehler in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/Ng entered
State requests $500 sig bond w/conditions.
BTC: $500 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.
